dlgLine.text: This morning, a Lieutenant Adair came to the shelter on behalf of the US Military. Adair is claiming to be leading what's left of the military forces originally sent into the cities several months ago.
He's asking us for 50 rations worth of food. If we help him out, he promises to answer questions about what the military knows about what's going on.
Given our past interactions with outsiders, I can understand any reservations about fulfilling his request. However, he's not threatening us or promising us easy answers. So... what should we do?
If the military couldn't contain things the first time, I don't know how they expect to do it now. And, to be honest, we've already seen this scam pulled before.
If they're really military, they can fend for themselves. I don't want to fight them, but if they're legit, they'll leave us alone.
<To you> But I trust you to make the right call on this one - I'll back you, however you choose to handle this.
We can't afford to help them... tell them no.

Their story checks out and the timelines he cited would be correct, but I have a few concerns. I'd like to hope there's still a unified force out there trying to make a difference, but we've seen very little evidence of that.

Tactically, we don't want to get on their bad side. These are experienced soldiers and they've probably seen worse than us. If Adair has managed to keep his company together under extreme conditions, he's the real deal. We should help him.
<To you> I'm going to go with your vote on this one - you talked to him, so maybe you got a better read on what he's about.
I know we could always use the supplies, but let's help him.
You all know how I feel about charity. Let's take a look at this from a tactical perspective. They've been fighting a losing battle for a long time. How many are left, you think?

They've got weapons and supplies - probably still have a helicopter or two. I say we tell Adair to fuck right off, find his base, and take their stuff. Who cares about their mission? This is our big score - we do this, no one can touch us.
<To you> If you're not a fan, I suppose I can see things your way.
We don't know how desperate he's going to get, so send him on his way for now. We'll need to hit their base before they decide what's ours is theirs.
I've said it before and I'll say it again...
Fuck the military. In fact, let's just make it clear to them - you come around here again, we will turn you into living scarecrows.
<To you> ...I could be persuaded to vote your way, but man, these guys really piss me off. Coming around here and asking for shit... That's my food, motherfucker.
When they come back, the only thing we should give 'em is a warning shot.
I think people here still want to believe that someone is looking out for us. We should help them.
<To you> However, if you feel it's a waste of supplies, I'll back you.
I have to hope that Lieutenant Adair is sincere. Let's give him the food.
Obviously, the last group of soldiers was a fraud, and it pains me to admit that maybe some of us should not have been as enthusiastic as we were about assisting that group.
But, I still believe that supporting the troops is the right thing to do.
<To you> I understand if you're hesitant to trust them - I'll support you on this, whatever your decision.
We should give the soldiers what they asked for.
<To you> Well... how should we treat Adair's request?

dlgAnsw.text: We're not giving them the supplies. We can't spare that many.
We'll give them the 50 rations they need as a show of good faith.
I propose we give them 25 rations. I'll convince them we're giving them all we can spare.
I propose we stand up to them now! We can not show weakness - they need to know we will fight them if they come back!
We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to not give Adair any of our resources. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to give Adair the 50 rations he asked for. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to give them half of the requested supplies and convince them that we're complying as best as we can. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to show a display of force in order to keep Adair and his men from trying to prey on the shelter in the future. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The final decision is to refuse Adair's request.
It's for the best. We've been doing this for months - food isn't going to get any easier to find and we can't just give it out, no matter the reason.
It's for the best. We've been doing this for months - food isn't going to get any easier to find and we can't just give it out, no matter the reason.
I realize you've got your reasons to not give out food - I guess it's for the best.
I know we've had trust issues with other groups in the past, but I know that if I was in Adair's situation, I'd go out of my way to assist any group that helped keep my men fed.
This is a good first step, but I think we need to consider eliminating them before they get desperate.
This is a good first step, but I think we need to consider eliminating them before they get desperate.
If you think so...
All this does is encourage them to try again later.
I suppose I can't fault you for being cautious.
I know that food is scarce, but we could use more allies and fewer enemies. To avoid any potential conflict, we should have given them what they asked for.
If this is how you think we need to do things, then I'm willing to do my part, I suppose.
I'm sorry, but my position remains unchanged - those soldiers came here with good intentions and we should have helped them.
VOID.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I'm not really on board with this... but I'll cash in one of my favors to you and go along with it.
That couldn't be farther from what I want. You want me to give up food for these people? I don't even know half their names.
Eat less? You know, I'll do it because I guess sometimes you don't make me regret coming here, but don't make this a regular thing.
You want ME to eat less?! What the hell kind of logic is that? We're in charge - if anything, it should be the other way around.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
I disagree, but... maybe you'll prove me wrong, I don't know.
It's a strong move... I like it. It sends the right message and buys good will in a way that nothing else will. Sure, we'll have to tighten our belts, but everyone will see us do it.
The decision is to give Adair the supplies he requested.
If you think it's for the best...
We've had to work extra hard to find food lately. Unless this guy was willing to help us out somehow, I'm not sure what this gets us.
I'm glad you agree. I have a good feeling about Adair and I think it's wise to start building a bridge between our two groups.
I'm glad you agree. I have a good feeling about Adair and I think it's wise to start building a bridge between our two groups.
I suppose, if that's how you want to do things.
Ask yourself this - if they're begging at our door, how effective of a fighting force do you think they really are?
I don't think this is the right course of action, but if this doesn't work, I trust you'll take them down for it.
We should make them leave Splendid needing bandages, not giving them food.
We're doing the right thing. Hopefully, we can form some kind of alliance with them in the future.
We're doing the right thing. Hopefully, we can form some kind of alliance with them in the future.
I think this is the right thing to do, and hopefully these soldiers will pay back the kindness somehow.
I think this is the right thing to do, and hopefully these soldiers will pay back the kindness somehow.
The decision is to offer Adair less, but reassure him that we're doing as much as we can to help.
I'm okay with this... I would rather we held on to that food, but who knows, maybe they can repay the favor one day.
I'm okay with this... I would rather we held on to that food, but who knows, maybe they can repay the favor one day.
I'm okay with giving them less, as long as they think we're cooperating.
I'm okay with giving them less, as long as they think we're cooperating.
If you think it's going to help, I suppose we can try it.
You're just encouraging them to come back and ask for more. We should be taking them down while they're weak.
I don't know... we can try it.
Those soldiers are just another group looking to take our shit. When the fuck are you going to learn?
I'd have given them what they asked for, but I do think our gesture will still be accepted.
I'd have given them what they asked for, but I do think our gesture will still be accepted.
Well, we're still helping them... And to be fair, you can be convincing when you want to be.
Well, we're still helping them... And to be fair, you can be convincing when you want to be.
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to threaten Adair in order to keep the military from coming back with more demands.
I can understand your concerns... Guess we'll worry about the consequences later.
Great, another enemy, just what we need. I'm sure everyone's going to be thrilled to hear that.
...I really wish you hadn't gone this route, but I'll do what I can to support you if they don't take it well.
What the hell does that get us? Do you really want to go to war with the US military?
Now they're going to see us coming... but I suppose if we hit them soon and get them out of the way, we'll be okay.
The best way to win a fight is to hit someone when they're least expecting it. This is the tactical equivalent of jumping in front of an elephant and throwing a firecracker at it.
Yes, exactly - fuck these guys. If we show them we're willing to fight, they'll go find someone else to give them their bribe.
Yes, exactly - fuck these guys. If we show them we're willing to fight, they'll go find someone else to give them their bribe.
I'm not sure what good this will do us, but I'll try to keep everyone's spirits high.
This is a pretty extreme response. I don't think violence is a suitable option in this case.
Well... I suppose they could be a threat...
This is crossing the line into insanity - I don't know how any rational leader could put us at risk like that.
That concludes our meeting... We'll inform Adair of our answer the next time he shows up.
